# Folder Structure

This is the structure we will use for our ShinyApp from now. The structure is similar to the set up in our [GitHub repo](https://github.com/leoallen8/2022_DSPG_Zimbabwe) wit the ShinyApp folder. Please follow this closely and make this folder in your branch for now.

## Main Folder: "ShinyApp". This is also the working directory.

see link: <https://github.com/leoallen8/2022_DSPG_Zimbabwe/tree/main/ShinyApp>

```{r, echo=FALSE,out.height='100%', out.width = '50%', fig.align = 'center'}
knitr::include_graphics(path =  "C:/Users/Leo Allen/Desktop/DSPG/2022_DSPG_Zimbabwe/Review/Leo/misc/images/pasteF005807E.png")
```

Under the main we have the following subfolders Sub-folders/files:

-   data : strictly the data files that will make the shiny app run

-   www: image and other media files

-   app.R (script)

NB: This folder will also contain the app.R script for the shiny (and then the rsconnect after deployment to shinyapps.io)

# Reading data samples

[tip set the working directory to the ShinyApp folder]

***Reading shapefile***

zim_district \<- st_read("./data/shapefiles/Zim_D60.shp")

zim_region \<- st_read("./data/shapefiles/agro-ecological-regions.shp")

***Frankie EVI:***

GrSs2017 \<- read_csv("./data/agregion/evi/EVI_region_GrSs2017.csv")

EVI_region_long \<- read_csv("./data/agregion/evi/EVI_region_long.csv")

***Ari Soil:***

mydatXL2 \<- read_csv(paste0(getwd(),"/data/agregion/soil/soil_ts_Zimb.csv"))

mydat_long \<- readRDS("./data/agregion/soil/mydat_long.RDS")

***Josue Rain:***

total1011 \<- readRDS(paste0(getwd(),file = "/data/agregion/soil/total1011.RDS"))

total1617 \<- readRDS(paste0(getwd(),file = "/data/agregion/soil/total1617.RDS"))

End
